### LƐM BEROM    
Ma se wok gul<br>
Yaga ma vɔk rugu wɛt<br>
Yin a di ma se yuu<br>
Yaga nu hom he tɔk bang mɛ wɛt<br>
Sede yin a yong e yey min<br>
Na yin e sɛlɛ me gwamin<br>
Ko a tɛ gbing gbing<br>
Na yin e ra pyɛ jining<br>
(Yin) bang me na rugu lɛm BEROM<br>



Kwon ha sɛ mwangalang<br>
Mwangalang sede ne mwangalang mwangalang<br>
Ma jut mwɛlɛng<br>
Ma jut yege ko ma gaba<br>
Vwel o ha yang me<br>
Sogo yi e ra bek hom<br>
Za a hom a vwel Berom<br>
Sede be nong o negbey<br>
Be nong o negbey lɛm Berom<br>



Di<br>
Netyang na pɔlɔ lis<br>
Yas tanga necik<br>
Ba ro hɛn ding ding<br>
Ma wo da yɛn e duk hwal min<br>
De netyang na polo lis<br>
Na yas na necik<br>
Ba di wo duk hwal o<br>
Na behal o<br>
Be to como na vwel Berom<br>


Yɛn a kaba a me fwong<br>
Ba hoto fwong o<br>
Fwong o gwa hwo tosho<br>
Yaga neroyo mo<br>
Na se sede yom<br>
De ba hongo e gwo fwa<br>
Hongo ndom<br>
Yɛn a ye<br>
À so mot, à so mot, à so mot<br>
Sede hwo simo<br>
Na wot e sogo<br>
Yi e gwad yom gwomo<br>
Kambok, pat ot<br>
Yi e ngamo<br>
Hwo wo na wot<br>
E duk hwal lɛm BEROM<br>


### BEROM LANGUAGE   
I'm cold<br>
Because I don't have clothes<br>
You can see that I'm silent<br>
Because my lips can't blanket me<br>
When you plan in your hearts<br>
To help me your brother<br>
Then it is necessary<br>
For you to do one thing<br>
You should blanket me with the cloth of the Berom language<br>

The place is dark<br>
It is dark like the darkness of the dark<br>
I turned left<br>
I turned right then I fell<br>
The ground said to me<br>
Get off my body<br>
My name is Berom land<br>
If you'll be given the light<br>
You'll be given the light of the Berom language<br>

See<br>
Prosperity and longevity<br>
Wealth and righteousness<br>
became very ill<br>
So I took them to your hospital<br>
But when prosperity and longevity<br>
and wealth and righteousness<br>
saw that the hospital<br>
and the medication<br>
Wage war against Berom land<br>
They held my ear<br>
They pulled the ear<br>
The ear began to cry<br>
Because of the excruciating pain<br>
that was like the suffering<br>
that was ground on a grinding stone<br>
of poison<br>
They said<br>
O our son, O our son, O our son<br>
If you want us<br>
to rise<br>
from this bed of suffering<br>
Please, take us away<br>
from here<br>
then move us<br>
to the hospital of Berom language<br>
